title: None
description: Company description:Discover a career with purpose at MBIEJob description:   Discover a career with purpose at MBIE      Join us in creating a dynamic, future-focused, customer-centric and new revitalised Insights Unit Unleash the power of research and insights to support MBIE to deliver its complex policy work programme Look ahead and work across MBIE's policy groups to enable an uplift in our insights capability Permanent position, Wellington based Salary Band: $75,114 - $88,266 plus Kiwisaver & Wellness Benefits    This an exciting opportunity for Insights Analyst/s to join our new Insights Unit!   About the team:  The new Insights Unit comprises two teams in Workplace Relations and Safety Policy, Labour, Science and Enterprise. The role/s reports to an Insights Manager.  These are a multi-disciplinary teams of analysts, researchers and evaluators. We apply a range of analytical skills and methodologies to provide high quality evidence and insights on New Zealand across the MBIE policy portfolios for Government, MBIE, and a range of external stakeholders. Our work is interesting, topical and has impact.     Tēnei tūranga - About the Role:     Our Insights Work Programme is complex and multifaceted and covers a wide spectrum of MBIE policy portfolios, such as: migration, employment & skills, building system, economic development, science & energy. We support and influence the policy debate and provide direct advice to Government and information to stakeholders and the public.   We are looking for an Analyst/s to contribute to this work. In this role, you will have responsibility for scoping, researching, analysing and presenting insights in compelling narratives. You will also have a commitment to innovation and continuous improvement and generating new ideas and ways of doing things. You will be supporting a range of analytic, and research related activities associated with the Insights Work Programme whilst contributing to the wider MBIE policy portfolios.  You will be enthusiastic with a passion for research, analysis and insights. You will enjoy working within and across teams to achieve goals and have a demonstrated ability to manage and plan work to meet deadlines.      Ngā pukenga me ngā wheako e hiahiatia ana - Skills and Experience Required:     To be successful in this role you will need to demonstrate (several of the following):    A customer-centric approach, with the ability to quickly establish and build strong working relationships and to develop trust and credibility with staff and key internal customers and external stakeholders. A proactive, can-do attitude with a high level of initiative, sound judgement and discretion Extensive knowledge of research, evaluation or analytical disciplines  Enjoy solving complex analytical problems A demonstrable background in the use of quantitative and analytical research methods The ability to translate complex and technical information into compelling narratives and insights to be easily understood by non-technical staff Foster an open, collaborative environment that encourages quality, innovation, on-going learning and knowledge sharing Exceptional teamwork and collaborative abilities, and a willingness to share knowledge and expertise with others Highly developed communication and writing skills  A tertiary qualification in socio-economics or a related discipline    Why work for us? The Insights Unit develops the Insights and Evidence for MBIE's decision making. We provide trusted and compelling narratives on the impact and effectiveness of government initiatives and formulate insights to inform future policy decisions. We provide the research, analysis, and insights that help decision-makers do their best work. With about 20 staff in the unit, we have a broad range of expertise and offer excellent opportunities for development. This includes active Communities of Practice enabling sharing of knowledge and skills.     Ētahi kōrero mō MBIE - About MBIE:     MBIE's goal is to create a resilient and high-performing economy that delivers real and ongoing quality of life for all New Zealanders. We do this by working with others to create an environment that supports businesses to be more productive and internationally competitive, enables all New Zealanders to participate in the economy through improved job opportunities and by working to ensure quality housing is more affordable. People are at the heart of our mahi, our way of working is guided by our values which shape our behaviours.  Mahi Tahi - Better Together Māia - Bold and brave Pae Kahurangi - Build our Future Pono Me Te Tika - Own It    Our aspirations are echoed in our Māori identity - Hīkina Whakatutuki - which broadly means ‘lifting to make successful'. MBIE recognises the partnership founded under Te Tiriti o Waitangi between Māori and the Crown and is committed to giving effect to Te Tiriti o Waitangi. We will do this through enduring, meaningful and effective partnerships with iwi, Māori, other Māori groups/organisations and the Crown, as this is critical to enable economic and social development, both for Māori and for wider Aotearoa New Zealand. We are committed to continuing to partner with iwi in order to find new sustainable solutions to address long standing systemic and cross-cutting issues facing Māori and wider Aotearoa New Zealand and we are also committed to identifying opportunities for iwi to lead and creating an enabling environment for iwi to leverage these opportunities.   E mōhio ana a Hīkina Whakatutuki i puea ake te kōtuinga I waenganui i a ngāi Māori me te Karauna i Te Tiriti o Waitangi, ā, kei te whai ia ki te whakaū ake i Te Tiriti o Waitangi. Mā te whai kiko o ngā kōtuinga ahungaroa o ngāi wi, o ngāi Māori, me ētahi atu rōpū Māori ki te Karauna, katutuki tēnei. He āhuatanga nui tēnei e āhei ai ngā mahi whanaketanga ā-ohanga, ā-pāpori hoki ki a ngāi Māori me Aotearoa whānui. E whai tonu ana mātou ki te kōtui atu ki ngā iwi mō te rapu huarahi hou ki te whakaara i ngā kaupapakua roa nei e tāmi ana i a ngāi Māori me Aotearoa whānui, ā, e whai ana hoki ki te tautohu i ngā āheinga kōkiritanga mā ngā iwi, me te tautoko i ngā iwi kia whai mana ake ai ēnei āheinga.     Me pēhea te tono - How to Apply:   Click here to view a position description. All applications must be submitted via our online process and include a Cover Letter and CV outlining your interest and suitability for the role.    Email Roxana Anderson at [email protected] quoting ref MBIE/16101 if you have any further questions.   Applications close on Friday, 22nd November 2024

description: ABOUT THE COMPANY:Our client is a well-known award-winning global investor organisation that is helping the future for all Kiwis. The team is supportive, and all share a purpose to improve the future generations of New Zealanders.They offer excellent flexibility, benefits and bonuses for all of their staff and have created an environment within their team that is supportive and offers continual growth opportunities for their staff. They are one of New Zealand's top companies to work for. ABOUT THE ROLE: This role sits within the Data Operations team that support systems and data production for the wider business. Data is at the core of their business and the team supports the daily operations and production. This role sits within the wider Data Technology team and you will build data products and systems so that the world's top-performing sovereign wealth fund can achieve its purpose of providing sustainable investments delivering strong returns for all New Zealanders.   The team also creates and maintains high-quality tools that assist with investment decision-making and supports key business initiatives to aid productivity. You will also work closely with Technology Services, Data Services; Business Solutions and Data Analytics teams to ensure services are delivered as efficiently and safely as possible. This is a newly created role and combines aspects of platform engineering, cloud engineering and data engineering. They are in the phase of adopting the new data platform and have a modern data suite they have introduced.You’ll be ensuring the optimal performance, availability, and reliability of the Guardians' data platforms, including the new IDAP platform. This role involves maintaining existing systems, supporting the transition to IDAP, and driving operational excellence through automation, monitoring, and user support. The ideal candidate will take a pragmatic approach towards optimizing processes, demonstrating leadership and ownership in their role. Decisions are constantly being made around best practices however in the practical implementation, the best solution is not always the right solution. So, we are looking for someone who takes a pragmatic approach towards optimization of processes.The key modern data suite is Snowflake. ADF, Coalesce & Precisely. Key responsibilities:   Support the Data Operations team in maintaining the health of the Data Platform, addressing issues proactively to ensure peak performance and reliability. Maintain data encryption, access controls, and authentication processes. Collaborate with the Cloud Operations team to integrate data platform capabilities and enhance team skills. Implement performance improvements and expand platform capabilities. Address escalated work requests and enhancements as required. Help create and manage maintenance schedules for the Data Technology team. Support development teams in deploying new changes through a structured release process. Serve as the subject matter expert on Data Platform capabilities, assisting team members with queries and issues. Provide training and guidance to users to optimize their use of the Data Platform. Implement monitoring tools and reports to track platform performance, usage, health, cost, user activity, and areas for improvement. Share knowledge and insights through workshops, training sessions, and documentation. Offer technical leadership and maintain internal documentation for Data Technology components. Advise on application security, licensing, upgrades, backups, and disaster recovery.  ABOUT YOU  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. At least 5 years of relevant experience in a data-focused role. Strong analytical skills with a structured approach to problem-solving and process design. Excellent verbal and written communication skills for interacting with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Knowledge of capital markets is desirable; asset management or buy-side experience preferred. Experience with automated build and release pipelines, especially TFS, Terraform, and Azure DevOps Pipelines. Familiarity with agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban. Experience with scripting languages like PowerShell, Bash, and JavaScript. Understanding of database principles and experience with Microsoft SQL Server, SnowFlake, or similar systems. Knowledge of data pipeline technologies such as SSIS, ADF, and Coalesce. Ability to take initiative, work under pressure, and maintain focus through proactive planning and organization. Proven ability to manage and optimize data platforms for high performance and reliability. Collegial and constructive approach, with strong internal and external relationship-building skills.  NEXT STEPS:Please apply online or if you're interested in finding out more information before applying, please reach out to Claire Lowe, Talent Manager Lead at [email protected]

title: Business Consultant & IT Technician
description: Implementation Consultant & IT Technician This dynamic role blends front-line IT support with consulting for client onboarding and adoption of the monday.com platform. The ideal candidate will handle basic IT issues, escalate more complex cases, and assist in implementing and configuring monday.com to optimise workflows and boost productivity. This client-facing position is perfect for someone with 2 - 3 years of client experience, a passion for technology, and a strong desire to expand both their technical and consulting skills.IT Support Responsibilities:You will provide front-line helpdesk support to resolve IT tickets for multiple clients across various industries. This includes addressing technical issues related to hardware, software, and networks, and escalating more complex problems to senior technicians when necessary. Responsibilities include:Responding to and resolving basic IT tickets (Level 1) through phone, email, or remote assistanceTroubleshooting issues related to Windows, macOS and Linux operating systems, network connectivity, and common software applicationsSetting up and configuring hardware, such as desktops, laptops, printers, and mobile devicesPerforming routine system maintenance, software updates, and backupsDocumenting solutions and escalating more complex issues to Level 2 or higherCollaborating with senior technicians and the broader IT team to address client technical challengesmonday.com Implementation Responsibilities:You will also support clients in optimising their workflows by assisting in the implementation of the monday.com platform. This involves working closely with clients to understand their business needs, creating customised workflows, and ensuring successful onboarding. Responsibilities include:Assisting clients with the configuration and setup of monday.com to meet their unique business needsConducting discovery sessions to identify key workflows and integrations that will benefit from automation on monday.comDeveloping and optimising workflows, dashboards, and integrations within the platformProviding training and support to clients to ensure smooth onboarding and usage of monday.comActing as a liaison between clients and the Wisely team to ensure client satisfaction and platform adoptionTroubleshooting basic issues within monday.com and working with the technical team to resolve more complex problemsTechnical Knowledge and Skills:Familiarity with Windows and macOS operating systems, Linux a bonusBasic networking knowledge (DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP)System and software troubleshooting skillsExperience with helpdesk ticketing systems is a plusBasic understanding of security practices (e.g., antivirus, MFA)Willingness to learn and master monday.com and its functionalitiesKnowledge of Active Directory, Office 365, Google, and other cloud platforms is an advantage but not requiredImpact:This role will play a key part in ensuring Wisely’s clients’ IT systems and platforms are fully operational and optimised for their business needs. By providing IT support and driving monday.com implementation, you will help clients reduce downtime, increase productivity, and improve collaboration.Behaviour/Additional Responsibilities:Lead troubleshooting for routine IT tickets and assist with larger projects when neededSupport senior consultants in implementing advanced monday.com use casesContribute to team brainstorming sessions and share insights for improving client solutionsDocument processes and solutions for knowledge sharing within the teamStay updated with new technology trends, tools, and best practices to provide the best solutions for clientsOwnership and Autonomy:Independently manage and resolve Level 1 IT ticketsAssist with Level 2 support and escalate when necessaryManage smaller monday.com implementation projects, including onboarding and workflow setupProactively communicate progress and any challenges with both clients and internal teamsTeamwork and Collaboration:Work closely with Wisely’s IT team and implementation consultants to resolve client issues and deliver projectsCollaborate with senior staff to enhance service delivery and ensure seamless project executionShare knowledge and best practices to improve team performanceCommunication and Client Relationships:Maintain clear, professional communication with clients and internal teamsExplain technical issues in a user-friendly mannerBuild and maintain strong working relationships with clients to understand their IT needs and drive monday.com adoptionAdditional Information:In this role, you will have the opportunity to:Gain hands-on experience in both IT support and consultingWork closely with clients to solve technical issues and streamline their business processesBe part of a growing team that values innovation and continuous learningThis is an excellent opportunity for individuals eager to advance their IT careers while developing consulting and project management skills through hands-on experience with the monday.com platform.Access to Expertise:At Wisely, you will not only be part of a supportive team but also gain access to an exceptional pool of talent and expertise across multiple domains. Our team combines years of experience in IT management, system integration, business process automation, and consulting, all of which will provide valuable insights and guidance as you grow in your role. You will collaborate with seasoned IT professionals, monday.com implementation consultants, and workflow automation experts, learning from their successes and challenges. This collective expertise will empower you to:Master advanced technical troubleshooting and IT support strategiesLearn best practices in implementing and optimising the monday.com platformGain deep insights into workflow automation, business process improvement, and client consultingReceive ongoing mentorship and training to further your technical and consulting skillsBy joining Wisely, you will be part of a dynamic team where continuous learning, innovation, and knowledge-sharing are at the heart of everything we do.

title: Implementation & Support Coordinator
description:
Who are we?At Medi-Map, we’re transforming how medication is managed, putting patient outcomes and healthcare efficiency at the forefront. Our mission is simple yet powerful: to build an innovative shared care medication management platform that leads to better health outcomes for everyone. By leveraging cutting-edge technology, deep healthcare insights, and an unwavering passion for innovation, we’re taking medication management into the future. Now, we’re looking for someone who shares our passion and drive to help bring our solutions to life for our clients. Could that be you? Why we need you?As the Implementation and Onboarding Specialist, you’ll play a crucial role in ensuring our customers across New Zealand and Australia have a smooth, seamless experience adopting the Medi-Map platform. You’ll be the first point of contact for client support, guiding them through implementation, training, and ongoing platform use. From project kick-off to go-live and beyond, you’ll ensure the best customer service standards are maintained and deliver real value.What you'll be doing?
Be the go-to person for customer onboarding, project implementation, and frontline support via phone and email. 
Keep our CRM up to date with all customer interactions. 
Regularly update stakeholders on the progress of projects and key milestones. 
Create and manage documentation for customer projects, including training materials and user guides. 
Deliver tailored training and support to a wide range of healthcare providers across New Zealand and Australia. 
Assist with testing new product releases and enhancements. 
Work with the sales team to conduct product demonstrations and pre-sale discussions. 
Be part of an on-call roster to support our clients when they need us most. 
What you'll bring?
Experience in software implementation, customer support, or a similar role. 
A strong understanding of the healthcare sector and the ability to explain technical concepts to different stakeholders. 
Experience with CRMs, and comfort managing data and customer records. 
Excellent time management skills—you’ll need to juggle multiple priorities and meet deadlines. 
Great communication skills—you can build rapport with people from all walks of life. 
A proactive problem-solver with the initiative to think ahead and address challenges before they arise. 
Valid New Zealand driver’s license and access to a vehicle. 
Why join us?
Casual Fridays every day! 
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements. 
Snacks, because who doesn’t love a good snack? 
Be part of a small but growing team, offering you massive exposure and learning opportunities. 
Professional development to help you grow your career. 
Join a company with rapid growth plans—you’ll make an impact right from the start. 
Ready to take healthcare into the 21st century with us? Apply now and help Medi-Map continue driving change in medication management across New Zealand and Australia!

title: Software Engineer Node.js / to $150k
description: Join a rapidly expanding Kiwi SaaS start-up who are profitable and well-funded. They have developed a business solution that enables business operators to manage a critical and complex application easily. They are committed to growing across multiple international markets and leading the way in their domain.They are now looking for a skilled Node.js developer to join their small talented team.You need to be genuinely people oriented, constantly curious, energised by solving problems and making a personal difference. The role also requires your demonstrated ability to bring the balance of positivity and fun within the wider company team who are passionate about helping our customers and each other succeed. What’s involved in the role?Executing work according to plan, managing timelines and communicating changes.Understanding business requirements and their context and using them to make informed decisions.Providing technical input, advice and feedback to both developers and non-developersYou will demonstrate excellent software architecture design and be a natural technical problem solver.Being an ace at front end development with Angular or similar and Typescript, efficient and clean with your code and have a good design sense.Experience with back-end development among node js frameworks and general web app development with scalability in mind. What do you contribute?4+ years of industry experience as a full stack web developer.Deep understanding of OOP and SOLID.Strong experience in a modern JavaScript framework.Experience designing and developing enterprise grade softwareExcellent communication skills to perform your role and interact with other departments and stakeholders.A plus would be comfortable with App Development on various platforms.Experience with concurrent development source control (Git) and continuous integration (AzureDevOps).Knowledge of document databases and NOSQL.Change management is something you embrace rather than the status quo.Possess a strong work ethic with a "can do" attitude.You will need to be a NZ resident or hold a valid NZ working visa. Why Join?We are a fast growing business who love working together as a team making our software successful. You’ll have the opportunity to be a key member of our team, be an integral part of our incredible wider team and work on products that are used by our customers worldwide while growing your career and developing new skills.  Apply now or call Barry or Craig on 0274992733

title: None
description: We are not just another blue & white IT company, we know there are many but we are special. Unique in size, in approach, with our people, our brand - all of it. The Instillery is a passionate team of wonderful diverse humans, dedicated to delivering first class IT solutions to our clients and we are looking for someone who’s ready to join us. As a Senior Project Manager, you'll be responsible for managing and delivering well run, profitable projects that provide best in class outcomes to our clients. You’ll lead best practice industry standards in project methodology, managing the polished development of projects, their stakeholders, and resources across a diverse range of digital projects.The role will involve:The effective management and delivery of projects to exceed our clients expectations including on budget, on point regular comms, and progress tracking. Leading communications with the client throughout the entire project lifecycle, maintaining effective relationships both internally and externally in a professional manner. Debriefing and sharing any learnings from implementations across the business to improve future projects for innovations, templates etcManaging all financial aspects of the project, ensuring accurate and timely tracking of costs against budget, project invoicing, processing timesheets of the technical resources allocated to the project, tracking expenditure against the forecast and updating as required.Providing solutions for any problems that occur during the project lifecycle and approaching them in a systematic manner.  We’re looking for… A Senior Project Manager (5+ years) with experience managing medium to large ICT projects With the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyConfident in delivering modernisation/transformation-type projects (Cloud, Modern Work and Network)Also, self managed with the right attitude to proactively take ownership to execute successful projects And finally, with a natural ability to understand, relate and translate customer requirements and expectations. We will provide you…A competitive salary and benefits incl birthday leave & a mobile allowanceWorking with wonderful down to earth people Professional development opportunities including training, certs and industry eventsCentral offices, ability to hybrid work with some set days in officeFlat management structure, ease of decision making We would love to hear from you if you fit the above, and are keen to join us. Apply now, don't wait. The People & Capability Team review all applicants for suitability but realistically can only get back to those shortlisted initially, so please respect this process and allow us to reach out if you are indeed shortlisted.If you have previously applied, please note that this is a new vacancy. We have your details on file and will reach out if your application aligns with our needs. Thank you!Candidates should be ready, willing and able to work in NZ please, and no agencies need apply at this point, we can find you when we need.

title: None
description: We have an interesting proposition available for those who have commercial experience with AI tools such as LangChain and Flowise and are keen to move across the ditch – do I have your attention?We are working with a start up business, who are scaling fast and with considerable financial backing – looking to have a big impact on how enterprises integrate AI tools into their environment across the globe. They are moving at pace to build their initial product offering at present, and because of the niche area they are working in are open, and would be keen to see if any Kiwi’s might be keen to hop over and join them? They are currently looking for Senior Developers, those who can comfortably tackle complex coding tasks, solutioning, and working through a fair amount of uncertainty without issue (this is a start-up; it’s par for the course). Key technical focus at present is on Node.js, Python, LangChain and Flowise, and familiarity with cloud environments and SRE tooling (Kubernetes and Docker) would be helpful, as would an appreciation for security compliance standards.There is potential for you to end up client facing in some way shape or form, so strong communication skills are a must, as would be the ability to explain fairly complex technical concepts to business stakeholders – think professional services type set ups. And getting in at the start with this business could fast track your ability to progress within the business if that is something you would be interested in. Please note due to security reasons, they are not currently interested in engaging Kiwi’s to work remotely from NZ, so if you are successful in securing a role they will expect you to move before commencing in this role. HOW TO APPLY:Please click APPLY online including an up-to-date CV including your relevant experience or for further information contact Tabitha Flack on 02102543053 for a confidential chat.

title: None
description: Since 1992 we have come a long way from a one-man-band to the team of 230 we are today across NZ and Australia.We are looking for a new team member to join our IT team as our Automation Test Specialist. We are looking for someone with a strong work ethic and who is passionate about leading continuous improvement of our testing. You have strong communication skills with the special ability to translate complex topics into plain language that is easily understood by our non-tech focused teams. This is a technical role within the IT team and is responsible for advancing the software testing capabilities. The role is focused on testing TR in-house applications and external services utilised by TR Group. You will work closely with our business stakeholders to identify, build and manage quality testing services across the organisation.About the role:Actively engage with stakeholders to identify and analyse valuable information which enables quality testing outcomes - creating great relationships along the wayParticipate in technology team planning, development, and release cyclesGrow testing knowledge across the TR Group technology team and lead and manage testing projectsAnalyse how testing can be applied to business applicationsProduce and maintain documentation that details testing frameworks and tools across the businessProvide recommendations to the technology team for issues discovered in business applications during testingProvide analysis and advice on performance testing resultsWork with Microsoft SQL and associated database services across the organisation from a testing perspectiveDevelop reports to clearly show the testing outcomes for the business over timeManage testing source code across the businessCreate test plans for each business applicationAutomate testing as part of the TR Group’s implementation of CI/CD processesProduce and maintain high quality documentation for all test plansTo be successful in this position, you will:Have experience in Agile environmentsHave strong experience with capturing user stories and business processes in deep detailHave 2+ years working with tools such as Selenium and Cypress on languages such as C#, .NET,JavaScript and NodeJSBe familiar with GITHave experience with automation tools such as Bamboo, Jenkins, or OctopusPossess a good understanding of Docker and containerizationHave experience with Microsoft Azure and cloud based IAAS solutionsWe are turning an exciting page within the IT space at TR Group, and building on some great foundations to be even better. If you're up for a challenge, like to be surrounded with a team of passionate people, and part of industry that is growing and growing - this might be a role for you. If you want to know a little more about us, check us out here:https://www.trgroup.co.nz/careers/

description:

Kia ora, Talofa lava, Kia Orana, Malo e lelei, Fakalofa lahi atu, Bula Vinaka and Namaste!
If you've always wanted to apply your skills to a large-scale Kiwi success story, then today is your lucky day - as we are on the lookout for a Software Consultant to join us!  Nau mai ki ASB!

title: Senior Network Engineer NZ
description: The Story Join this healthcare and pharmaceutical business that represents some of the world’s largest medical brands. With a number of vertical businesses across wholesale and retail pharmaceuticals, this business is continuing to acquire and experience growth. With operations across the APAC region this represents an opportunity for a Senior Network Engineer to join the team in Auckland NZ,  as they embark on a lengthy pipeline of work uplifting their technical capabilities and many exciting projects.  The Role The Senior Network Engineer will play a critical role in the success of the team (part of a team of two Senior Network Engineers) through the support and maintenance of key technologies and infrastructure, managing Incidents and Requests to deliver services and is comfortable being a key stakeholder in the team, working collaboratively with technical and non-technical stakeholders and engaging with stakeholders up to Executive level. The role will provide support and assistance to the broader team with the extensive expertise across all aspects of networks, with strong collaboration with the infrastructure and application teams, security teams and business partners.  The role will be a mix of both BAU and projects.    Key projects to be involved in include: SDWAN, wireless standards rollout, network access control, VPN migrations, a full technology refresh and there is a good few exciting projects in the pipeline relating to network security!  What You Bring To The Role:Minimum 10+ years proven experience designing critical network environments. A strong background in managing and maintaining high availability and complex networks in an enterprise environment (minimum 1000+ users), including Firewalls, Intrusion Prevention/Detection Systems, Load Balancers, IPSEC VPN, Routing and Switching, Data Centre Network, Network Monitoring and Security.Solid experience in Azure & AWS Cloud Infrastructure networking and security.Project experience including implementation of complex enterprise environments.Knowledge and experience with Juniper, Palo-Alto and Aruba technologies (will consider Cisco but must have Palo Alto and/or Juniper.)What's In It For You?A vibrant, fast-paced environment with loads of growth opportunities.HQ for tech, is Melbourne based, but this role will be based from Auckland NZ and form part of their growing NZ team, based from brand new warehouses being built near Auckland airport. Hybrid work arrangement, requiring 3 days work in office. Next Steps: If you're a team player, comfortable to adapt to ever-changing environments, and have been looking for an opportunity where you can showcase and apply your breadth of knowledge across the network space, whilst being part of a wonderful team and business who support a good work-life balance, I would love to hear from you!  Get in touch with any queries or apply online! ''

title: None
description: Technical Product Owner - Networks He angitūtanga: The OpportunityAuckland Council is seeking an experienced Technical Product Owner - Networks to join our Technology Services team. This is a unique opportunity to lead the strategic development and delivery of innovative, resilient network infrastructure solutions. You'll play a pivotal role in our transition to a product-based delivery model, working closely with cross-functional teams and vendors to ensure the delivery of high-quality network services that meet both business and customer needs. He kōrero mōu: About YouAre you ready to drive change and innovation in network infrastructure? As a Technical Product Owner, you will lead the prioritization of the network roadmap, ensuring the delivery of impactful services and solutions. You will collaborate with vendors and stakeholders to design resilient, customer-focused network services, manage the business impact of incidents, and ensure seamless communication throughout. Your goal will be to build network solutions that are scalable, secure, and future-proof. We are looking for a strategic thinker with a collaborative mindset who can integrate emerging technologies and play a key role in the evolution of network services. Key Responsibilities Roadmap & Prioritization: Define and prioritize the network services product roadmap, ensuring alignment with business objectives and customer needs. Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner with engineering, security, operations, and business teams to translate requirements into actionable, high-quality network solutions. Vendor & Stakeholder Management: Manage vendor relationships, ensuring the delivery of network solutions that meet performance, security, and reliability standards. Incident Management: Oversee network incidents, minimize business impact, and keep stakeholders informed with clear, timely updates. Future-Proof Design: Ensure network solutions are scalable, secure, and aligned with best practices, emerging technologies, and industry trends. Lifecycle Management: Oversee the full product lifecycle, from development and deployment to ongoing optimization.  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 10+ years' experience in the network services domain, with expertise in product management and cross-functional team leadership. Strong understanding of Agile practices and product development methodologies. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels. Proven ability to lead teams, drive projects, and solve complex problems.  Benefits Professional Growth: Ongoing development opportunities to help you progress in your career. Collaborative Environment: A supportive, inclusive culture that values teamwork and innovation. Flexible Work Options: Enjoy a work-life balance with flexible working arrangements to suit your lifestyle.  If you are a visionary Technical Product Owner eager to shape the future of network services, we'd love to hear from you. Join Auckland Council's Technology Services team and help us deliver impactful, innovative solutions that benefit the communities of Tāmaki Makaurau.

title: None
description:
Join our ICT Team at ANZCO Foods as a Technical Test Engineer. This position is a fulltime permanent position based at our Corporate Office in Christchurch. This position will see you reporting to our Application Support and Release Manager.
The Software Technical Test Engineer will be responsible for manual and automated testing of different software/systems developed for the company. ANZCO's testing team is a pioneer in using RPA tool for automated regression testing and is integrated to Azure DevOps as our test and defect management tool.
Ideal Candidates for this role will possess excellent communication skills, keen attention to detail, and a strong analytical mindset. Success in this position comes from a proactive approach to problem solving and the ability to work independently. If you thrive in a self driven environment and bring relevant experience this could be your next opportunity.
Duties and Responsibilities will include but won't be limited to:

Review user requirements document to ensure that requirements are testable and ask meaningful questions that will yield more information to help perform testing effectively.
Recommend, build, and maintain automated testing tools that can integrate to ANZCO's ecosystem.
Develop test plans, manual test cases, automated test scripts and test reports on multiple projects of varying size.
Execute tests and log bug work items with complete information that helps in defect resolution.
Engage in all test phases and testing activities to ensure the solutions are fully tested, test deliverables are documented and sign off acquired to proceed to next phase.

Skills and Experience we are looking for:

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field experience
Proven experience as a Software Technical Test Engineer or similar role
Knowledge in Software Development Life Cycle Methodologies such as Agile, V-Model, and Waterfall
Knowledge in Test Automation
Knowledge in Test and Defect Management
Familiarity with CMMI and Agile processes
Ability to perform root cause analysis and document the errors
Working knowledge of test and defect management software (e.g., Azure DevOps, JIRA, ALM) and SQL or equivalent

We deliver taste, nutrition, and wellbeing to the world with products made from New Zealand finest beef and lamb. Our values of atawhaitanga, noho haepapa, kaitiakitanga, auahatanga, and whakawhirinakitanga guide us to work together, follow through on our commitments, make improvements, and do our best to make sustainable decisions for the future.
We are committed to supporting and developing our people and we offer a competitive remuneration package. If you are motivated, have the skills and experience we require and want to be part of the exciting future of our company then we want to hear from you.
Apply today at www.careers.anzcofoods.com
Applications close: Monday 18th November 2024

title: None
description: Want to be involved in building visualizations to support an exciting, high growth business? Want to join an exceptional team delivering high value solutions? Want to feel like YOU really matter, and where your input is valued, and your career is as important to your employer as it is to you?  Fusion5 is in an exciting time of growth, and we are looking for a talented and highly engaged Senior Reporting Developer Analyst to join us in either Auckland, or Melbourne. In return for your skills, you’ll be valued for your input and join a team like no other!   We have a very successful track record in delivering business solutions to support our fast growing enterprise.   For internal reporting we use the tools that we sell and support for our customers; Fusion5 are a Microsoft Solutions Partner for Data and AI and hold the Analytics on Microsoft Azure Specialisation. We’ve been a member of the Microsoft Inner Circle since 2017 and a Cloud Solutions Partner. As part of the Inner Circle, we’re called upon to contribute to Microsoft’s own business applications strategy and the aspects that impact partners like us.   This role is an internally focused role, that will report into our cross functional Business Systems team. You will also work closely with our Microsoft Data and Analytics teams to support our reporting needs, our data lake, several major systems initiatives, and ongoing creation and maintenance of reports to support our ELT, SLT and Operational Leaders.  You will love this role if you are someone who likes to take on technical challenges, thinks outside the box to deliver reporting insights, and keeps up with the latest and greatest Microsoft has to offer.   We’re looking for a strong player who can:  Deliver impactful solutions, translating complex business needs into clear and actionable reporting solutions that drive real value to our business. Be a team player, working closely with members of multiple teams throughout the organisation to deliver cross functional data and reporting and data solutions. Contribute to all aspects of our internal data lake and reporting projects including analysis and design, build, test, and deployment. Become a trusted advisor to our leadership team, building strong relationships and acting as a credible source of information and guidance on all things Power BI and Microsoft Fabric. Drive success, managing workloads efficiently and adhering to deadlines while maintaining high-quality standards.  The successful candidate will have the following technical capabilities:  Power BI expertise: In-depth knowledge of Power BI Desktop, Service, and administration, with the ability to design and implement complex data models, reports, and dashboards. Data modeling: A strong understanding of dimensional modeling concepts (including Kimball) and best practices for building efficient and scalable data models in Power BI. DAX proficiency: The ability to write complex DAX formulas to manipulate and analyse data, creating dynamic and insightful reports. Data transformation expertise: Proficiency in Power Query (M) for data cleansing, transformation, and shaping within Power BI. Data integration: Experience integrating data from various sources (relational databases, cloud storage, APIs) into Power BI using best practices for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL/ELT). T-SQL skills: The ability to write efficient T-SQL queries to extract, manipulate and test data from relational databases for use in Power BI. Microsoft Fabric and Azure familiarity: Working knowledge and experience in Microsoft Fabric and the Azure cloud platform, including Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Lake Gen2, and Azure SQL Database.  The successful candidate will have the following consulting capabilities:  Effectively gather requirements through interviews, workshops, and user stories, ensuring a clear understanding of needs and goals. Excellent documentation skills including developing functional and technical specifications, as well as assisting with the creation of accurate estimates. Confidence in designing and delivering effective training sessions for end-users on Power BI and Microsoft Fabric functionalities and best practices. Presents well with clear written and verbal communications. Able to communicate with a wide range of people and present information and solutions to a variety of audiences, tailoring communication style to different levels of technical expertise. Strong time management and coordination skills and the ability to manage and prioritise competing tasks across multiple work streams.  It is advantageous to have the following skills:  Report design principles: Knowledge of data visualisation best practices and the ability to create clear, concise, and visually appealing reports and dashboards. Experience with Lakehouse architecture. Experience with other cloud platforms; AWS, Snowflake, Informatica Experience with reporting/visualisation tools including Cognos, Tableau, Qlik Experience with ELT and Modelling tools; including dbt, Coalesce, and WhereScape Experience with advanced analytics using ML models. Microsoft technical certifications  PL-300: Power BI Data Analyst Associate DP-600: Fabric Analytics Engineer Associate DP-203: Azure Data Engineer Associate    Our commitment to you:  A warm, open, and collaborative environment where you receive all the support necessary for success, including being mentored by experienced and respected Data and Analytics experts. We measure our success at a team level to ensure your input forms part of the wider team and no individuals are singled out. There are no barriers to mentorship at Fusion5. We are passionate about investing in the development of our team. We offer countless learning and development opportunities aligned to individuals’ development paths and encourage you to pursue industry certifications to stay ahead of the curve and reach your full potential. A raft of employee benefits such as flexible working arrangements, a day off on your birthday and a day to focus on your volunteer activities each year. We have regular social occasions at all our offices and organise outings and events to suit all tastes. A committed leadership team who are obsessed with your career and development. We have transformed ourselves from a traditional, performance review culture to one that focuses on Employee Development with monthly sessions that ensure we are working together on achieving your career goals. An incredible team culture that must be experienced to be believed. We are a hard-working bunch that celebrates success and supports each other. Here at Fusion5, you’re never on your own with a problem. After all, a problem shared is a problem halved!  If you are interested in joining a team passionate about helping customers achieve great outcomes – get in touch.

description: Company description:IAG is not only the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, underwriting over $AUD13 billion of premium per annum, we're also a tech and research facility, a hub for climate change experts and a centre of resilience design. We chat over coffee with customers, advocate for them in the corridors of Parliament and back them up in the community when life's moments hit hardest.Job description:Have meaningful impact as a Digital Product Owner Lead - Claims.Join the largest general insurance group in Aotearoa New Zealand and Australia.  Mō te Tūranga | About the Role Shape the Future as Our Digital Product Owner Lead! Join us on an exciting journey of transformation as our Digital Product Owner Lead for our Digital Claims experience and be part of a new and dynamic team that's redefining digital experiences in New Zealand.This isn't just another job—it's an opportunity to be at the forefront of our company's evolution. We're on a mission to reimagine how our brands stand out in the digital landscape. With our digital and data teams at the core of this transformation, you'll have the creative freedom to lead initiatives that make a significant impact on our customers, driving seamless, low-effort experiences that truly set us apart.As the Digital Product Owner Lead, you will define and manage your squad's backlog, ensuring they align with strategic objectives. Collaborating with the claims team you'll help us reimagine how our claims experience shows up in our digital assets across Apps and Web to ensure our customers have a great digital experience.Leading agile practices, you'll foster a culture of continuous improvement, helping your squad grow in agile maturity and high-performance delivery. You will work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements, manage interdependencies, and ensure seamless collaboration across squads and portfolios. Providing regular updates on progress, risks, and spend against cost/benefits, you'll ensure transparency using tools like SharePoint, JIRA, and Confluence.Finally, you will oversee initiative close-out activities, including post-implementation reviews and handovers to business-as-usual operations, ensuring a smooth transition and long-term success.This is a permanent full-time position with hybrid working conditions, available at any of our IAG offices across New Zealand, with a preference for those located in Auckland. Ōu Pūkenga | About You We're excited to engage with skilled professionals who possess the following expertise and experience:Digital Leadership: Proven experience in digital program delivery and product ownership, with a strong understanding of Agile methodology or SCRUM certification.Strategic Insight: Strong commercial acumen and a demonstrated ability to manage complexity, navigate ambiguity, and respond to change. Team Excellence: Experience leading high-performance matrix teams, with exceptional influencing skills and a track record of building collaborative partnerships across various levels of the organisation.Continuous Improvement: A passion for fostering a continuous improvement environment, with a focus on delivering key programs of work that align with agile methodologies. This is your chance to be a part of something transformative. As our Digital Product Owner Lead, you'll play a pivotal role in our journey to redefine digital experiences in New Zealand, working with a dynamic team that's full of energy and innovation. Apply now to be part of a team that's not just keeping up with the digital age but leading it.Applications close Tuesday, 12 November 2024 at 11:59pm. Mō mātou| About us IAG is the largest general insurance group in Aotearoa New Zealand and Australia. We're also a tech and research facility, a hub for climate change experts and a centre of resilience design. We chat over coffee with customers, advocate for them in the corridors of Parliament and back them up in the community when life's moments hit hardest. You'll know our brands - AMI, NZI, State Insurance, NRMA Insurance, CGU, WFI and ROLLiN' to name a few. Together they turn our IAG purpose of making your world safer into action by helping, supporting ambitions and making insurance accessible.We acknowledge Tāngata Whenua in Aotearoa and are committed to growing Māori prosperity and well-being in Aotearoa through He Rautaki Māori (IAG's Māori Strategy). We celebrate unique viewpoints shaped by life experiences, cultures and passions. We expand careers, genuinely connect with community, lead with a powerful purpose and celebrate what makes you individual. We're passionate about social issues, walk the talk on sustainability and strive to do more than standard on things that matter, including women in senior leadership, Indigenous empowerment and creating inclusive environments. We're proud to be an accredited family-friendly workplace and are committed to being a safe and supportive space for all our employees.  We do this because we're ready for you.All this shows up in what we offer:   Boost your financial future with 4% KiwiSaver employer contribution and life insurance as standard Up to 50% off personal insurance, including home and motor insurance Annual $500 wellbeing fund Flexibility through our MyFlex program - supporting you to live life to the full Grow your skills and career development with the IAG Academy program We're ready for you. Apply today.  Learn more about who IAG is here.

description: Our client is a leading innovator in the built environment, and they’re dedicated to harnessing data-driven insights to support their operational efficiency and strategic decision-making. And at Magnetic, we’re excited to be supporting them in taking a fresh approach to their master data management, reinforcing accountability across their business divisions to ensure data accuracy and reliability. As a result, we’re looking for an experienced and detail-focused Data Manager to drive this effort and play a critical role in enhancing data integrity within the business.In this position, you’ll manage the end-to-end process of uploading and maintaining master data across D365 environments, working closely with subject matter experts from various divisions across the wider business and licence holders. You’ll provide essential data templates, oversee data population and verification, and manage the process from initial test uploads through to final production stages. You’ll also take on ad-hoc reporting support and be encouraged to utilise and grow your skills in SQL and Power BI. Key Responsibilities:Data Management: Oversee the uploading of all master data into D365 test and production environments in line with business processes.Supply structured data templates for SMEs to populate, validate, and approve.Format and organise large datasets for consistent and efficient upload.Coordinate with SMEs to review and verify data in test environments, only committing data to production after quality assessments.Reporting & Analytics: Support internal teams by fulfilling reporting needs across systems including D365, and other industry and business-related ERP and software packages.Perform data extraction using DMF framework, SQL queries, and other tools.Develop insights using the client’s information systems and Power BI as part of ongoing analytics capability building.ERP & Systems Support: Contribute to D365 updates and assist with data integrations, working alongside IT to streamline data processes.Training & Development: Provide training to empower team members in data manipulation and reporting.The ideal candidate will:Be a data-driven professional with excellent technical skills and a keen eye for detail. You will bring strong data management experience, ideally within ERP environments, and enjoy working collaboratively with teams, with positivity, to uphold high standards of data accuracy. You’ll be proficient in Excel and SQL and have a knack for communicating effectively across the organisation. A natural problem-solver, you’ll be diligent, resilient, and committed to quality control. Your Skills and Experience:Proven experience in data management, ideally within ERP environments (D365 knowledge is advantageous).Relevant tertiary qualification in business analysis, data science / engineering or similar.Relevant Microsoft certifications in Power BI and D365 would be preferred.Advanced Excel skills, with an ability to handle and arrange large data volumes.Familiarity with SQL and Power BI, or a strong willingness to grow in these areas.Detail-oriented and able to work autonomously with focus and resilience.Excellent communication skills, with confidence interacting across various teams and levels.Experience in training others on data processes is essential.This role provides a unique opportunity to be central to data quality initiatives, supporting internal teams to take full ownership of their data processes. Under the mentorship of an experienced D365 expert, you’ll gain valuable experience in ERP data management and develop sought-after skills in reporting and analytics. This position offers pathways to future roles in business analytics or finance, as part of a team dedicated to continuous improvement. We’re committed to building diverse and inclusive teams and welcome applications from all qualified individuals, provided you have full permanent working rights in NZ. Apply Today:If you have the experience and attention to detail needed for this role, we’d love to hear from you. Submit your CV and a cover letter outlining your experience and interest.  At Magnetic, we're relentlessly curious about what drives you. And once we understand that, we draw on our deep connections to find your next role — the one that truly aligns with your career compass. Be Magnetic.

description: He angitūtanga: The opportunity   Auckland Council's Technology Services team is on the lookout for an exceptional Practice Manager to lead our Platform Engineering practice team. This is your chance to drive innovation, enhance our engineering capability, and make a significant impact on the communities we serve in Tāmaki Makaurau.  He kōrero mōu: About you   As the Practice Manager at Auckland Council, you'll lead an enthusiastic team of infrastructure engineers, fostering a vibrant culture of innovation and excellence. This team supports the software platforms that and enable our Kaimahi to serve Aucklanders. You'll ensure high-quality standards while supporting the team embrace a journey to devops and attracting top talent to serve our community. With a strong ability to set clear performance goals and provide constructive feedback, you'll inspire your team through engaging knowledge-sharing sessions. Building strong relationships with stakeholders will be essential as you develop a strategic approach that aligns our initiatives with Auckland Council's vision and the dynamic needs of our community. Join us to make a meaningful impact and drive our success forward—while having fun along the way! Responsibilities:   Team Leadership: Oversee and manage a team of platform engineers -  providing guidance, coaching, mentorship, and support.     Quality Assurance: Ensure high standards of work within the Practice and adherence to best practices.     Process Improvement: Implement and optimise product management processes, methodologies, and frameworks.     Talent Development: Recruit, hire, and develop software engineers, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.     Performance Management: Set performance expectations, provide feedback, and conduct performance reviews for team members.     Knowledge sharing: Facilitate knowledge sharing sessions and encourage continuous learning across the Practice.     Stakeholder Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders.     Practice Strategy: Establishes and maintains a practice strategy that balances the businesses current and future needs of the practice with the sourcing and talent management approach.   Qualifications:   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT  or related experience or field.     Proven experience as a Practice Manager or similar leadership role (5+ years) and can manage teams of greater than 30 people.      Strong understanding of platforms including SAP, Salesforce, Mulesoft and know what good platform engineering is.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to lead and inspire a team to achieve high performance.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.    Benefits:   Professional Growth: Access to ongoing professional development opportunities to enhance your career trajectory.     Collaborative Environment: Work within a supportive and inclusive culture that values teamwork and innovation.     Flexible Work Arrangements: Enjoy a work-life balance that suits your needs, with flexible options available.    If you are a dedicated and visionary Practice Manager ready to shape the future of Auckland Council's technology services, we encourage you to apply. Join us in making a meaningful impact for our community!

description: Mō te tīma / About our teamThe Disability Support Services Group (DSS) is being established to ensure fairer access to disability support services in New Zealand, ensuring those with the greatest needs receive quality support services. The DSS Review Taskforce has been established to implement the recommendations of the Independent Review in DSS to:provide disabled people with certain and consistent access to DSS, no matter what their circumstances or where they live in New Zealandprioritise funding for disabled people with the highest needs, and those who would benefit most from early intervention support,ensure that Enabling Good Lives (EGL) principles are put into practiceensure that the long-term sustainability of DSS is strengthened to provide disabled people and carers with services that are both fair and affordable.Te āhua o te tūranga / About the role:As the Senior Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in determining the scope of work and planning effective delivery strategies within the Disability Support Services Taskforce.You will engage with internal and external stakeholders to ensure clear communication, aligned expectations, and a coordinated approach to project delivery. Key Responsibilities:•    Lead the analysis, planning, and delivery of diverse work programmes.•    Track the progress of work items, ensuring timely delivery of outcomes.•    Provide specialist input and contribute to project status reports, identifying risks and mitigation strategies.•    Offer high-quality advice on complex issues with minimal guidance.•    Develop and present strategic recommendations to senior management and Ministers.•    Identify and document business goals and needs accurately.•    Gather and analyse business processes to inform system requirements.We value diversity and welcome applications from disabled people and those who have lived experience with whānau, or the disability community. Please contact us if there is any support that we can provide to ensure the recruitment process is accessible to you. This is a 6 month fixed term role. Nōu te rourou | What you bring:A proven track record as a Senior Business Analyst, particularly within large transformation programmes in government settings.A deep understanding and experience working in the Disability Sector and the unique requirements it brings. The ability to effectively scope and allocate tasks to Business Analysts to ensure efficient workflow and project delivery.Strong critical thinking and analysis skills in the development of effective business solutions.Demonstrated success in building and maintaining positive working relationships with diverse stakeholders.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel and Outlook and specialist project management tools such as Visio, PowerPoint, Jira, Confluence or SharePoint.Position DescriptionA copy of the position description can be found here. Senior Business Analyst position description.Salary range: $102,533 - $124,402About us The Ministry of Social Development is a people-centred organisation. We’re in communities across the motu, working with partners to help New Zealanders be safe, strong and independent.We provide social policy and advice to government and assistance, including income, employment and housing support to people of all ages, families, whānau and communities.As a Te Tiriti o Waitangi partner we are committed to supporting and enabling Māori, whānau, hapū, Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.Our people are as diverse as the communities we serve. We care about the wellbeing and success of our people and provide a supportive and inclusive working environment where people can thrive and be who they are.How to applyTo apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV, cover letter and complete the online application form.Note: Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience relates to the key responsibilities listed in the position description. All applications must be made online.  If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at [email protected]Internal MSD Employees – please apply through your myHR portal at work. This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as internal candidate.Closing date:  Sunday 17 November 2024. Joining usJoining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with Māori, Hapū, Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.MSD has a COVID-19 vaccination policy that encourages, but does not require, employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and its variants, unless the role is identified as requiring vaccination at the time.

description:
Port of Auckland plays an essential role in our economy, delivering the things we need and enjoy. 
Nearly three-quarters of the port's inbound cargo stays within the Auckland and Upper Waikato region. Our location on Auckland's doorstep means the delivery of goods is quick, the cost of goods is low, and we are focusing on reducing our carbon footprint to become a sustainable Port. We also have a network of freight hubs throughout the North Island, to improve access to the port for the provinces.
Join our Team as Digital Technology Project Manager based at our Mechanics Bay office.
ABOUT THE ROLE | Te tūranga mahi
Are you ready to take your career to the next level? As our Digital Technology Project Manager (DTPM), you'll be at the forefront of driving innovative technology projects. In this key role, you'll collaborate with cross-functional teams, manage timelines and budgets, and ensure our initiatives align with our strategic vision. We're seeking a leader with a strong blend of technical expertise, leadership skills, and project management capabilities to make a real impact.  
ABOUT YOU | Ko wai koe
We're seeking a candidate with a strong background and a minimum of 5-7 years of experience in project delivery, who excels in collaborative environments. This role supports our Digital team by managing the daily operational and tactical aspects of significant digital projects across IT and the wider business, leveraging your passion for technology and innovation.
WHAT YOU NEED | Ngā pūkenga me whēako
As a Digital Technology Project Manager, you'll support our Digital team by managing significant digital projects across IT and the broader business. Your responsibilities will include:

Full Project Ownership: Lead projects from scoping to successful delivery, adhering to our PMO Governance and Change Management Framework.
Performance Measurement: Ensure regular reporting and communication to keep everyone aligned and informed.
Leadership: Inspire and lead project teams, ensuring their work aligns with strategic goals.
Collaboration: Coordinate with internal teams and external partners to meet agreed success metrics—time, budget, quality, and scope.
Strategic Implementation: Manage cross-functional projects that drive technology and business change.
Project Planning: Break down complex projects into manageable work packages for efficient delivery.
Resource Management: Oversee budgets, timelines, and risks to ensure project success.
Business Impact Assessment: Support system owners in evaluating the broader implications of new systems and changes.
Decision Making: Facilitate informed business decisions within the project scope, driving successful outcomes.
Detailed Planning: Conduct thorough project planning to support 'go/no go' decisions and technical implementations.

OUR BENEFITS | Ngā Painga
(T&C's apply)
Our employee benefits and perks include:

Free onsite parking, annual flu shot, confidential counselling and support services
Free internal shuttle service to public transport hubs
Opportunity to participate in the 5th week annual leave programme
15 days wellbeing (sick) leave per annum
Career progression opportunities
Flexible working, hours and remote
Access to an onsite café, gym, and physiotherapist
Access to discounts at: Auckland Leisure Centres (excluding Olympic Pools), Electrify NZ, Southern Cross, Specsavers, Kindercare, Pets in the City, EnviroWaste, Ideal Electrical, HCB Technologies (car batteries), PB Technologies, Resene (Mt Wellington store)

We pride ourselves on being a great place to work and consider all employees part of the port whānau. 
At Port of Auckland, we celebrate and embrace diversity, and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds. We are dedicated to fostering an environment where Everyone can be themselves.
'Kia Kaha, Kia Maia. 'Give of your best, be confident in your ability'.

description:
At GHD, we don’t just believe in the power of commitment, we live and breathe it every day.

That’s why we pledge to support and empower our people to make a positive impact when working hand in hand with our business to drive change. We'll empower you with the right technology and training as you bring ideas and projects to life. 

Together with your colleagues, clients and partners, you can make an impact that is felt by all. See where your commitment could take you.

GHD is on the lookout for an experienced IS Technician to join our team. This role currently sits in Christchurch. 

You will provide client focused technical support and service on supported GHD technologies, applications and platforms to enable the delivery of work to GHD’s clients.

The role:

Complete assigned tasks via the ticketing system within defined service levels
	Effective diagnosis and resolution of client issues to minimise recurrence 
	Accurately update and/or log all tasks/client requests in the ticketing system
	Effectively prioritise tasks to ensure service levels/deadlines are met
	Report identified risks to your manager in accordance with the GHD Risk Management Framework
	Alignment to ISO Audit certification
	Accurate record-keeping and ensuring platforms remain updated
	Asset and fleet management
	Escalation and communication of incidents to other relevant internal IS teams
	Maintain integrity and governance by adhering to standard service desk procedures and  IS security protocols 
	Take opportunities to educate and coach clients to increase their technical skills and encourage self-service
	Continually build your knowledge of GHD’s business and technologies and keep up to date on industry trends and technologies


About you:

A bachelor’s degree Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent experience desirable
	Minimum 3 years’ experience in a helpdesk/desktop support role or similar in a large and/or global professional services organisation
	Industry Certification (ie ITIL, MCSE) would be an advantage 
	Strong technical knowledge of GHD operating systems, key hardware and software applications
	A good understanding of Cloud Deployment concepts and Azure cloud services desirable
	Knowledge of network cabling and TCP/IP networks, Active Directory 
	Excellent client service skills and communications skills
	Strong analysis and problem-solving skills 
	Team player, strong desire to learn, resilient, proactive
	Position is office based in Christchurch, must have flexibility with work hours and travelling to other locations if required


Click ‘Apply’ to submit your CV or reach out to Zen Chua ([email protected]) for more information.

 What's in it for you:

Insurances paid for by GHD (life, trauma and income protection
	Up to 20 days extra leave with our holiday buy-back scheme
	Daily interaction with high performing teams
	Professional development and ongoing training
	Competitive remuneration
	Flexible working arrangements for work-life balance
	Opportunities to learn from our industry experts and technical gurus across APAC.
	A highly supportive and collaborative team environment
	We will set you up for success with the latest hardware, tools and tech


Ki GHD, ka ākina te kaimahi e mātou kia tutuki ōna ake moemoeā. Nā te mea, ko te kaha o te tangata te tuarā o te pakihi. Nā reira, he hiahia nō mātou ki te whiwhi kaimahi nō ngā ahurea tuakiri maha, nō whenua rerekē, tane mai, wahine mai.

At GHD we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities and invites applications from people of all nationalities, genders, and cultural backgrounds.

We respectfully ask that no agency resumes be presented at this stage.

title: None
description:
Wellington or Auckland (Highbrook) location
Permanent role
Commercial, licensing and analysis activities

Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the role
Due to the retirement of a long-standing employee, we have a vacancy within our Data & Technology team for an IT business analyst who has focused their career on the Commercial and Software Licensing space. As the ideal candidate for this role, you will have excellent problem solving and analytical skills coupled with a deep understanding of the vendor landscape, software licensing positions, RFP processes and licensing requirements.
The primary focus of this role is to provide insight and analysis on our IT Suppliers and Software Licencing positions, model RFP and New Contract outcomes, and provide support with Procurement and Software Licencing processes and activities.
Your stakeholder management skills will be second to none, and you will be able to operate alongside technical experts but also translate technical jargon into plain English to ensure end users and customers also understand needs, and you're able to fully answer their queries.
Mōu - About you
This is a great opportunity to flex your experience with financial modelling, forecasting & reporting and apply it within a large complex organisation. You will already have multiple years' experience in a similar position along with the following qualifications, skills and experience.

Relevant IT or financial qualification
Proven experience managing complex data including analysis, assessment and delivery of robust recommendations.
Advanced MS excel skills including Visual Basic, and Power BI
Knowledge of licencing terms of the major software vendors
Collaborative working style, excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-driven and the ability to drive work through to conclusion.

Mō te Tukurau Aotearoa - About NZ Post
NZ Post is an iconic organisation with a rich history and bright future.  We're in the midst of transformational change as we disrupt our industry on our quest to be the #1 delivery partner for e-commerce.  It's an exciting time to join.
He Aha Te Pai - What you'll love about us! 
Alongside the opportunity to work with a team passionate about delivering, our permanent employees enjoy a wide variety of benefits including:

Free onsite secure parking at our Auckland sites
Special rates on fantastic holiday home accommodation around New Zealand
Retail shopping discounts with our partners
An Employee Assistance programme to support you when you need it
Plus more!!

Hiahia? - Interested? Come and join the whanau!
Bring your drive and results driven work ethic to the team at NZ Post.   If this sounds like your next career move, apply today, or to find out the full requirements of the role please download the JD available via the NZ Post website. If you require additional information, contact Gemma Corbett (Talent Acquisition Specialist) on 027 372 4705 or [email protected]
Applications for this position close on 10 November 2024.
Due to the fast-paced nature of NZ Post, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible.  
All applicants will also be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security and credit check and may be required to undertake a drug test. 
If you're interested in a role, please apply directly through our online portal. Our team of experienced in-house recruiters is the glue between our business and finding the right person for the role and we therefore won't consider candidates through agencies (unless previously arranged). 
There's something really special about being part of the team here at NZ Post - Tukurau Aotearoa, who we are and what we stand for is grounded in our values.
We are proud to be Rainbow Tick certified and recognise the diversity and uniqueness of our workforce and reaffirm our commitment to create a safe and inclusive environment for everyone.
