description: This is us.  Where you matter.Making a difference for all Kiwi starts with making a difference for our people. Flexibility, growth, challenging and rewarding work - this is Kiwibank. A place where you can belong and thrive – we are as ambitious as we are caring. We have big ideas and big plans. For you, for Kiwibank and for all Kiwi. This is us.  Where making an impact matters. Be part of Kiwibank as it takes banking for New Zealanders on an evolutionary journey. We are seeking a Senior C# Software Engineer to join our Product & Pricing team who are working on setting up Zafin with our product directory, establish pricing services, map data across complex entities, and provide interfaces for wider domain integration. The bank needs to integrate into a huge variety of systems, each bringing a unique set of engineering challenges. To help solve this, we have designed an GQL and an event-driven, cloud-based integration layer built on modern approaches and principles which sits as the nervous system of our engineering ecosystem. This is us.  Where your expertise matters. We are after strong C# + .NET Core engineers that love new challenges and have experience building with a variety of technologies. As Kiwibank engineers, we are growing an engineering-driven culture with a strong focus on being adaptable, learning from each other, and maintaining open communication channels. 5+ years development experience with C#, ASP.NET Core, and .NET Core or similar.Experience with cloud native platformsExperience with Postgres, SQL Server or similar RDBMS. We use RDS Postgres for our databases. Experience with test automation as part of day-to-day development, ideally utilising TDD and BDD techniques. Performance testing experience is a bonus.Ability to collaborate with wider stakeholder group and assist with technical designsBonus:Experience with the Zafin Product & Pricing platform. Experience with microservice development for cloud native platforms and delivering apps to run on Docker/Kubernetes (AWS EKS or similar).Knowledge of API technologies such as GraphQL, REST, etc, and supporting contract formats such as OpenAPI/Swagger, AsyncAPI. Experience working within a regulated environment.Experience in CICD practices, drives and delivers via declarative deployment practices with automated quality and security built in.Effective verbal and written skills for communicating complex information effectively to a range of different audiences.You do not need to tick every box here to be considered! Apply Now – applications close on Monday 11th November. We will be reviewing resumes throughout the advertising period and reserve the right to withdraw the ad at any time.This is us.  Where you and your whānau matter.We want you to get the most out of work and life, so you will have the option to explore flexible working arrangements that suit both your needs and ours. We now also offer one wellbeing day a quarter to ensure our people are taken care of and can bring their best selves to work. Our great range of benefits include health and life cover, discounted banking, insurance products and an incredible package for new parents.We are proud to be a certified B Corporation and we are the first bank in Aotearoa to get the Gender Tick. We are also an accredited Living Wage employer. At Kiwibank we are all about making Kiwi better off For an idea about what life is like at Kiwibank and some of the benefits we offer make sure to check out the attached video.

title: None
description:
RealNZ is dedicated to delivering innovative technology solutions that drive both business success and ensure our guest experiences are extraordinary.
We are seeking a skilled Applications Support Specialist to join our Technology Team. In this role, you will be responsible for providing technical support for our business applications, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring that our people have the resources they need to succeed. If you are passionate about technology and enjoy helping others, we want to hear from you!
Key Responsibilities:

Provide exceptional technical support to users by diagnosing and resolving application-related issues.
Monitor application performance and implement updates or patches to ensure optimal functionality.
Develop user documentation and training materials to enhance user understanding and application effectiveness.
Collaborate with technology and development teams to gather user requirements and suggest improvements.
Participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) for new features and upgrades.
Identify trends in support requests and recommend process improvements.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
2+ years of experience in application support or a similar role.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Familiarity with ITIL based ticketing and change management processes
A working knowledge of Azure based integration platforms is preferred as is experience with any of the following applications:
Maximo, EcoPortal, RTP, Aspenware, Lightspeed, Fareharbor, Salesforce, Coupa and Navision

What's in it for you?

Enjoy some incredible staff perks! Bring a friend along to experience RealNZ's unforgettable adventures, either for free or at a fantastic discount. Explore thrilling jet boating, rafting, the Te Anau Glowworm Caves, cruise Milford and Doubtful Sound, and discover Rakiura. It's an amazing opportunity to experience the best of New Zealand without breaking the bank!
Free Cardrona x Treble Cone Season Pass
Medical insurance coverage

Who are we?
We are real people in real places delivering real experiences.
Enabled by tourism, our vision is to be a leading conservation business. We are committed to the future of sustainable tourism while honouring our past. Our guest centric attitude is fuelled by our promise to deliver Aotearoa's most unforgettable experiences.
Here at RealNZ we encourage people to be themselves, respect the environments we operate in and respect each other. We are committed to empowering people, so they can have a voice, be heard and be present.
Our people and our experiences stretch across our most remote islands and fiords to our snow-capped maunga; we are a diverse group of people, and our passion to share incredible environments and experiences with guests drives us every day. Join us on our mission to conserve nature, share our history and culture and have fun every step of the way.
Please note that we will be interviewing candidates as they apply, and if the right person is found, we may close the role off to any further applications.

description: 🚀 Become Our Next Product Analyst – eCommerce Payment Solutions! 🌟 Why We Need You:Worldline NZ (previously known as Paymark) has been rocking the payments scene since 1989, we are the OG of EFTPOS! We’ve powered nearly every Kiwi’s coffee run, grocery haul, and online shopping spree. Now, we’re on the lookout for a Product Analyst to join our crew and help us keep the cash flowing smoothly! If you’ve got a knack for numbers and a love for payments that borders on obsession, this might just be your dream job!What You’ll Be Doing:Customer Whisperer: You’ll be the friendly face our clients adore! Guiding them through onboarding and integrations whilst also being that second line of defence solving all technical product enquiries like a payment superhero—cape optional but encouraged.Stakeholder Juggler: Balancing conflicting requirements is your circus act. Grab your metaphorical clown shoes and keep everyone aligned!Process Ninja: Slice through inefficiencies and chop down red tape like a pro. Your motto? “Let’s make it faster, better, and with fewer headaches.”Agile Wizard: Use your magic to turn vague ideas into detailed specs in Confluence and Jira. You’ll be casting spells like “Epic” and “User Story” in no time!Success Storyteller: Share our victories like a bard of the digital age—complete with epic tales of product performance that’ll leave everyone cheering.Cross-Functional Party Starter: Bring together our developers, executives, and every expert in between for brainstorming sessions that are equal parts work and fun!What We’re Looking For (Besides a Sense of Humour):A detail-oriented doer who can turn chaos into order faster than you can say “payments processing.”Excellent communication skills—you can explain tech to a toddler or turn a spreadsheet into a gripping saga.Agile aficionado who knows the difference between Scrum and a sandwich Previous product support, product analyst or BA experience is a mustKnowledge of eCommerce payment products is a bonus (added bonus if you’ve used one to buy snacks 😉).A proactive team player who doesn’t mind getting their hands dirty. Why Worldline?At Worldline NZ, we understand that what matters to one person might not matter to another, so we’ve crafted a buffet of benefits that caters to everyone—yes, even you!Collaboration & Connection: Enjoy rad events that celebrate our vibrant hybrid culture. Work hard, play hard, right?Stunning New Office: Our purpose-built space in the heart of Auckland CBD comes with harbour views, an onsite bar and coffee shop, a gym, and all the top-notch tech you could dream of. Seriously, what more could you want?!Pick n Mix Benefits: Our employee benefits package lets you spend on what tickles your fancy—whether it’s wellness perks or fun experiences!On-Site Massage: Because who doesn’t love a good massage? Enjoy some well-deserved time out with our subsidized massage service.KiwiSaver Contribution: We’ve got your future covered with our KiwiSaver superannuation contribution.Recognition & Rewards: We believe in celebrating success! Our awesome rewards and recognition program ensures you’re appreciated for your hard work.We’re proud to have been awarded the Top Employer Award and Great Place to Work for 2023/24, as well as Small Workplace of the Year at the HeadFit Awards. We even snagged a finalist spot at the HRNZ Awards for Wellbeing and Innovation—so you know you’re joining a fantastic team!At Worldline NZ, we’re committed to being an equal opportunity employer, celebrating diversity and inclusion in the workplace. If you have any health-related needs we should accommodate, just let us know. Our recruitment process focuses on your unique strengths and how they fit each role.Join a company that’s not just about transactions but about transforming lives—one payment at a time! With us, you’ll have the chance to shape the future of payments while enjoying a culture that values creativity, collaboration, and the occasional Mum/Dad joke.Ready to dive into payments fun? Apply now, and let’s make financial magic together! ✨💸

title: None
description:
About the opportunities
We have 2x SRE vacancies - open to Intermediate and Senior SRE Engineers. Both roles are Auckland-based (CBD) and offer hybrid working. 
In Plexure we redefine the customer experience and drive results through personalized mobile marketing and next-generation loyalty programs for for household names such as McDonald's. Join our SRE squad and work alongside experienced Engineers focused on automating the operation and running of our systems as well as enabling maximum change velocity and system reliability. You will report to a Team Lead who is invested in providing mentoring and supporting your growth.Your day-to-day work will involve the development, maintenance and deployment of Infrastructure as Code, platform management (monitoring, alerting, provisioning, and configuration), enabling other teams to seamlessly interface with the platform, as well as identifying areas for improvement and where possible, implementing those improvements. You will also have a chance to contribute to a key ongoing project: developing further our self-service model that is used by multiple Engineering teams across the organization.Our tech stack: Azure DevOps, PowerShell, Python, New Relic, Docker, Kubernetes.

What are we looking for?
All SRE candidates:
outside of the box thinkers who enjoy being in an environment focused on innovation and continuous improvement;prior professional experience in an SRE role as well as good understanding of SRE practices;good verbal and written communication skills;collaborative team players.
Senior SRE candidates:
Bicep experience is preferred, but, if you have comparable experience with Terraform, for example, we`d still love to hear from you!must have good Azure experience, especially with Azure DevOps, Azure pipelines, Azure APIs;previous experience with coaching/mentoring Junior and Intermediate SRE Engineers is advantageous.
Intermediate SRE candidates:
Azure experience is preferred, but, if you have experience with any other cloud provider, we`d still love to hear from you!proactiveness and passion for identifying areas for improvement;curiosity and eagerness to learn.

What is in it for you?
Joining a global cloud-first organization where you get the opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies.Scale - we have 300+ million users on our platform in 60+ countries globally. Your work will make an impact on millions of users!Working with a high performing team and an empowering manager - we welcome creative suggestion and solutions.Ongoing career development and support - internal promotions are the norm! Flexible working that suits your work-life balance! You need to do the school run or save time by not sitting in traffic today? No problem - we trust you can do an excellent job from anywhere and are here to support you!Free Udemy subscription – choose from 180,000 available courses online! We encourage you to complete any courses you are interested in during working hoursTraining budget - $ 2,000 yearly on top of salary to use towards upskilling yourself (certification, professional membership, conference, etc.)Fully paid health insurance for yourself and discounts for family members (Southern Cross - Wellbeing 2.Fully paid life insurance and illness or injury income protection. Celebrate your birthday with an additional paid day off.New hospitality benefits - grab a free lunch or dinner in one of Sky City's restaurants.Mental health and wellness support such as EAP (Employee Assistance Program) and paid wellbeing days.Paid volunteering leave.A modern office with different work zones, a well-stocked kitchen, and a variety of social and team building activities. Discounted parking rates for 2 nearby parking garages in CBD. 

About Plexure
About Plexure: we are a cloud-first global SaaS company. We deliver an ambitious digital transformation program and drive results through personalized mobile marketing and next-generation loyalty programs for for household names such as McDonald's. Our in-house built cloud-based mobile engagement platform is used by 300+ million users in 60+ countries globally. Our culture: we offer the career guidance and care of a growing, established company coupled with diversity, challenge, and innovation excitement.

title: None
description:
Award winning IT shop
Join our high performing team
Deliver complex business domain solutions

Transpower owns and operates the national grid - the country's high voltage electricity transmission network. We work diligently to ensure a reliable and secure supply of electricity to all parts of Aotearoa New Zealand, while also working towards a net-zero carbon future.
About the team
Our Application Services team helps ensure electricity is delivered to all New Zealanders, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, by maintaining and evolving complex critical IT systems. The business domain we work within ensures there are always new and interesting challenges to tackle and that the work we do matters - electricity is essential to our economy, our health system, and the wellbeing of our citizens.
As a team we have been changing at a rapid pace, using new technologies to engineer modern web / mobile applications, intelligent AI/ML embedded automation to streamline workflows and functions, and adopting open-source software and DevOps methodologies to accelerate product delivery.
You will be joining an experienced and high performing team who care about their customers and their work. This is a role where you can truly make a positive impact on our people, organisation, and industry.
About the Opportunity
The market system is a modernised Java/Spring Boot application that handles the complexities of New Zealand's electricity market. It performs functions such as determines electricity spot prices, balancing real-time supply and demand to ensure system stability. This application manages inputs like electricity generation offers, demand forecasts, and system constraints, and follows a Security Constrained Economic Dispatch process to ensure the grid remains stable while minimising costs across pricing nodes.This role is focused in the Market System area contributing to a variety of initiatives, including business-led technical improvements and life-cycle refresh projects. This involves balancing both strategic business objectives and necessary technical upgrades to maintain and enhance the market system's performance.

About you
As a highly experienced Software Engineer, you'll find this role stimulating! You will naturally think broadly and seek to understand how your work contributes to the wider systems and strategic direction of Transpower, whilst leveraging your product development background and experience working across software development and operations.
To be considered your CV and cover letter will demonstrate:
Experience delivering complex domain business solutions with a passion for software delivery and quality. You will possess an innate desire to learn and understand the domain you are working within.
We are seeking 5+ years of analysis, design, and programming experience, including large scale application integration within complex business delivery, and in-depth knowledge of a broad range of hardware and software products. Your skills and experience will include working with applications DevOps toolchains for continuous build, integration, packaging, and deployment.
You will be able to demonstrate skills at a senior level across these languages / frameworks:
Must have:

Spring Boot/Java
Experience of building RESTful web services and JSON
Distributed services / REST / micro services architecture
Opensource frameworks
Maven/Gradle
Oracle

Ideal

OpenShift
Linux (RHEL)

Why you should join us
We stand together for New Zealand - Tū mai Aotearoa - to enable a 100% renewable energy future.
As an equal opportunity employer, we embrace diversity. Our people are made up of over 28 nationalities which makes for a dynamic and stimulating environment.
Our benefits include a range of health and lifestyle options to support your wellbeing. View them here: https://www.transpower.co.nz/about-us/careers/benefits
To learn more about an IT career at Transpower, please watch this short video: https://youtu.be/hkWDjmzTOT0
To learn more about our award-winning IT shop, please check out the following pages:
https://www.transpower.co.nz/news/market-system-transformation-nets-transpower-2024-red-hat-innovation-award
https://www.transpower.co.nz/about-us/celebrating-our-people/engineering-and-technology-excellence-awards/2024-winners
We are an accredited employer; therefore, visa sponsorship is available if required for qualified and experienced IT professionals who meet NZ Immigration requirements.
Next Steps
If you're ready to join a fun, collaborative, and results focused Application Services team who enjoy a varied and full programme of work, including many interesting and challenging projects with numerous opportunities to learn, we'd love to hear from you.
Please review the position description via our careers site https://careers.transpower.co.nz/search and apply without delay.
Role closes Tuesday 12th November. Applications will be reviewed as they are received, and exploratory conversations / interviews may be scheduled for shortlisted candidates ahead of the closing date.
